summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, primarily concerning travel approval requests and logistics for a team conducting interviews related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail planning for trips to Stockholm, Sweden, Los Angeles, and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for victim interviews and meetings, including requests for flight bookings, hotel reservations, and conference rooms.

persons.name: Maureen Comey
persons.context: Sent the initial travel approval request for the Epstein investigation, identifying the case as United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The prosecution team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, planned for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020, as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Planned Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: A team member requests permission to travel for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively flying Wednesday and returning by Friday.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requests permission to travel for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: A team member requests permission to travel for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Planned Meetings/Interviews in Florida
events.description: Team members request permission for travel for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.

The prosecution team was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple locations (Stockholm, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach) as late as January 2020, indicating the investigation was ongoing after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Travel logistics show a pattern of international and domestic trips specifically for interviews, often requiring hotel conference rooms to conduct them.
Email correspondents' names are largely redacted (shown as placeholders or initials like 'M'), but one identifiable official is Assistant U.S. Attorney Maureen Comey.
The travel planning includes detailed discussions of flight options (Delta, American Airlines), hotel selections (Sheraton Stockholm, Hotel Kung Carl), and per diem budget concerns.
